form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to require the Secretary of Transportation to waive vehicle weight limitations for certain logging vehicles, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Safe Routes Act of 2025.

section.header: Vehicle weight exemption for certain logging vehicles
section.text: Section 127 of title 23, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The Secretary shall waive, for a covered logging vehicle, the application of any vehicle weight limit established under this section.
The waiver under this subsection shall only apply with respect to a State legal weight tolerance in effect on the date of enactment of this subsection.
In this subsection, the term covered logging vehicle means a vehicle thatâ€”

subparagraph.text: is transporting raw or unfinished forest products, including logs, pulpwood, biomass, or wood chips;
is traveling a distance of not more than 150 air miles on the Interstate System from the point of origin to a storage or processing facility; and
meets applicable State legal weight tolerances and vehicle configurations for transporting raw or unfinished forest products within the boundaries of each State in which the vehicle is operating.
